error.signature: TS2344: Type 'X' does not satisfy the constraint 'Y'

verdict.summary: The type argument does not match the generic constraint defined with extends. Ensure the type has all required properties.

dead_ends.action: Remove the constraint entirely to accept any type
dead_ends.why_fails: The generic function likely depends on properties from the constraint; removing it causes errors inside the function

workarounds.action: Ensure the type argument satisfies all constraint properties
Use intersection types to add missing constraint properties
workarounds.how:
type WithId<T> = T & { id: string };
// Now WithId<MyType> satisfies constraints requiring id

leads_to.condition: When constraint fixes interact with conditional types

preceded_by.condition: When argument type errors are caused by constraint violations

frequently_confused_with.distinction: TS2345 is about function argument types; TS2344 is specifically about generic type parameter constraints
